docs.title: The AI Standards Manifesto
docs.description: The foundational manifesto establishing the AI Standards Foundation's principles for trustworthy, usable, and accountable AI systems. Sets out non-negotiable standards including clarity, reliability, transparency, accountability, and human-first design.

docs.title: Contributing to AI Standards
docs.description: A comprehensive guide for contributors explaining how to create issues for feature requests, submit pull requests, and follow the project's contribution process. Includes content guidelines, code of conduct, and recognition policies.

docs.title: AI Standards
docs.description: A comprehensive overview of the five core AI standards: Clarity over confusion, Reliability over chance, Transparency over obscurity, Accountability over excuses, and Human-first design. Provides brief descriptions of each standard and their importance.

docs.title: Accountability over Excuses
docs.description: Establishes that when AI fails, responsibility must be traceable. Covers governance assignment, redress mechanisms, audit requirements, and evaluation criteria to ensure clear accountability structures in AI systems.

docs.title: Clarity over Confusion
docs.description: Ensures AI systems communicate their limits and capabilities plainly. Includes requirements for capabilities disclosure, UI disclaimers, support data publication, and marketing accuracy to prevent user confusion and misuse.

docs.title: Human-First Design
docs.description: Ensures AI is built to empower human agency rather than replace it. Covers accessibility compliance, user override capabilities, inclusive testing, and ethical review processes to prioritize human welfare and dignity.

docs.title: Reliability over Chance
docs.description: Requires AI tools to perform consistently, not just occasionally. Addresses deterministic inference, regression testing, consistency metrics, fallback mechanisms, and monitoring to ensure dependable AI performance.

docs.title: Transparency over Obscurity
docs.description: Ensures users understand what drives AI outcomes rather than facing a black box. Covers model documentation, confidence reporting, auditability, and explainability features to provide visibility into AI decision-making processes.
